required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cesarean Wound Closure: Dermabond Versus Steri Strips
clinical_study.official_title: Cesarean Wound Closure: Dermabond Versus Steri Strips

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

clinical_study.source: University of Tennessee Health Science Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine overall patient satisfaction with their cesarean section scar with application of Steri-strips vs. Dermabond following subcuticular skin closure of pfannenstiel incision

primary_outcome.measure: Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale Surveys (POSAS)
primary_outcome.description: Validated scale comparing a scar to normal skin. Score ranges from 6 to 60 with the higher numbers less like normal skin.

primary_outcome.measure: Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale Surveys
primary_outcome.description: Validated scale comparing a scar to normal skin. Score ranges from 6 to 60 with the higher numbers less like normal skin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with wound infection
Number of patients with wound separation or dehiscence

intervention.description: Dermabond will be applied after subcuticular skin closure in lieu of Steri Strips
Steri Strips will be applied after subcuticular skin closure as routinely done at our institution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women age 18-45 who are undergoing planned or unscheduled cesarean section at Regional One Health
- Gestational age > 24 weeks
- Planned Pfannenstiel incision
- Willing to consent to the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency or urgent cesarean section
- Vertical skin incision
- Intrapartum intraamniotic infection
- Diabetes
- Unwilling to consent to the study

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Tennessee Health Science Center
